body: @marco-c Can you please elaborate a bit on this, and direct me towards which files I need to be looking into?
Is anybody working on this? If not, I'd be happy to help, given some more context of the problem.

@datavizard read the contributing rules, if there is no PR attached to an issue, it is unassigned. So, feel free to work on this (@kaushiksk feel free to work on this too, I had missed your message).
I've added more details in the first comment.

issue.title: [WIP] Issue 945 Additional analysis for binary classifiers

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
REF:  Issue #945 
This is not ready for review.

It was unclear from the contributing guidelines if you support "Work in Progress [WIP]" PRs, but I figured I'd submit one anyway.  Let me know if that's unfair to other contributors.  I'm also very open to collaborating on this with anyone else.

I've been getting familiar with the codebase and installing all of the necessary dependencies.  I still need to better understand the metrics data format to figure out the best way to branch logic for binary classifiers.  I'm currently running the training script (saw that it can take ~30 minutes) and will explore that further.  

Is there a unit test around this module?  I didn't see one, but wanted to make sure I modified it/added to it appropriately after my changes.

body: I would like to work on this but I dont have any previous experience so please guide me

Hello @rishishounak, you can follow the steps in the README to set the repository up, then you can run the scripts/retrieve_training_metrics.py script to make sure it works for you. Once everything is set up correctly, you can try to apply the required change (explained in the first comment of this issue) to the scripts/retrieve_training_metrics.py file.

issue.title: Plot classes separately in binary models.

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Issue #945 

I added plotting for classes '0' and '1' for binary classification models to `scripts/analyze_training_metrics.py`. Tested manually with `spambug` and `component` data fetched with the `scripts/retrieve_training_metrics.py` script.

The `analyze_training_metrics.py` was broken (because of how it extracted fields from file names), so I fixed that as well. It was not simple to install the environment due to some dependencies like xgboost and libgit2, but since they weren't necessary for this issue I simply skipped them.

I think it should be ready to merge. Please confirm that this is what was intended for #945.

This is my first ever PR to an open source project. So please do tell me if I've done anything wrong.

issue.title: Plot and check classes separately for binary models. #945

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
This analyzes the two classes separately for binary models rather than just checking the "average".

edit: #945 
Sorry, I didn't realize the issue number had to be in the comment.
